trans-unit.source: Extend Reports
The reports described in this section have been extended for use with cc|formatted documents.

seg-source.mrk: The reports described in this section have been extended for use with cc|formatted documents.

trans-unit.source: Data Structure of Reports
For a report to be used by cc|formatted documents, the following two new columns must be created below a DataItem:

seg-source.mrk: For a report to be used by cc|formatted documents, the following two new columns must be created below a DataItem:

trans-unit.source: FD_BLOB
Column of datatype “BLOB” – contains the formatted text of the record as binary data.

seg-source.mrk: Column of datatype “BLOB” – contains the formatted text of the record as binary data.

trans-unit.source: FD_RectangleForNo

Column of datatype “Text” – contains a unique identifier value for the record. This column usually does not exist as a field in the corresponding table, but contains (recommended) the primary key fields of the corresponding table as a combined text. The value must be unique.

seg-source.mrk: Column of datatype “Text” – contains a unique identifier value for the record.
This column usually does not exist as a field in the corresponding table, but contains (recommended) the primary key fields of the corresponding table as a combined text.

trans-unit.source: Both columns provide required information to the subreport and are constrained by the following naming convention:

seg-source.mrk: Both columns provide required information to the subreport and are constrained by the following naming convention:

trans-unit.source: [<SubreportIdentifier>_]FD_BLOB
[<SubreportIdentifier>_]FD_RectangleForNo
The prefix of the subreport is only required if multiple subreports are embedded in the main report. The “<SubreportIdentifier>” name needs to correspond to the subreport of the two fields.

seg-source.mrk: The prefix of the subreport is only required if multiple subreports are embedded in the main report.
The “<SubreportIdentifier>” name needs to correspond to the subreport of the two fields.

trans-unit.source: Summarizing explanation (as example):
[_]FD_BLOB
Field of the corresponding table with Data Type = BLOB.

seg-source.mrk: Field of the corresponding table with Data Type = BLOB.

trans-unit.source: Name: subreport2_FD_BLOB
SourceExpr: "FD Blob"
[_]FD_RectangleForNo
Primary key fields of the corresponding table as combined text.

seg-source.mrk: Primary key fields of the corresponding table as combined text.

trans-unit.source: Name: subreport2_FD_RectangleForNo
SourceExpr: FORMAT("Sales Line"."Document Type") + "Sales Line"."Document No." + FORMAT("Sales Line"."Line No.")

seg-source.mrk: SourceExpr: <span class="sourcecode" style="font-family: 'Courier New';">FORMAT("Sales Line"."Document Type") + "Sales Line"."Document No."

trans-unit.source: <MadCap:xref href="#_Ref428197773" class="Figure" xmlns:MadCap="http://www.madcapsoftware.com/Schemas/MadCap.xsd">Fig. 1</MadCap:xref> illustrates the above example.

seg-source.mrk: <MadCap:xref href="#_Ref428197773" class="Figure" xmlns:MadCap="http://www.madcapsoftware.com/Schemas/MadCap.xsd">Fig. 1</MadCap:xref> illustrates the above example.

trans-unit.source: : Sales Line Report
<MadCap:xref href="#_Ref428197791" class="Figure" xmlns:MadCap="http://www.madcapsoftware.com/Schemas/MadCap.xsd">Fig. 2</MadCap:xref> provides another example (as single subreport).

seg-source.mrk: <MadCap:xref href="#_Ref428197791" class="Figure" xmlns:MadCap="http://www.madcapsoftware.com/Schemas/MadCap.xsd">Fig. 2</MadCap:xref> provides another example (as single subreport).

trans-unit.source: : Sales Line Report as Single Subreport

seg-source.mrk: : Sales Line Report as Single Subreport

trans-unit.source: Important
The first DataItem of the report must not have a deviating name.

seg-source.mrk: The first DataItem of the report must not have a deviating name.

trans-unit.source: Layout of the Report (in Report Designer)

seg-source.mrk: Layout of the Report (in Report Designer)

trans-unit.source: Subreports can be placed anywhere in the main report, except in the header of the report. The name of the report can be user-defined; however, the name must match the prefix of the column names.

seg-source.mrk: Subreports can be placed anywhere in the main report, except in the header of the report.
The name of the report can be user-defined; however, the name must match the prefix of the column names.

trans-unit.source: The following parameters must (mandatory) and can (optionally) be given to a report:

seg-source.mrk: The following parameters must (mandatory) and can (optionally) be given to a report:

trans-unit.source:
Mandatory parameter (required):
  • RectangleForNo

Optional parameters (optional):
  • FontFamily
    • Default value: “Arial”
  • FontSize
    • Default value: “9pt”
  • TextColor
    • Default value: “black”
  •  PaddingLeft
    • Default value: “0pt”
  • PaddingRight
    • Default value: “0pt”
  •  PaddingTop
    • Default value: “0pt”
  •  PaddingBottom
    • Default value: “0pt”

<MadCap:xref href="#_Ref428197990" class="Figure" xmlns:MadCap="http://www.madcapsoftware.com/Schemas/MadCap.xsd">Fig. 3</MadCap:xref> is an example of the integration of a subreport (including assigning of parameters to the subreport).

seg-source.mrk: <MadCap:xref href="#_Ref428197990" class="Figure" xmlns:MadCap="http://www.madcapsoftware.com/Schemas/MadCap.xsd">Fig. 3</MadCap:xref> is an example of the integration of a subreport (including assigning of parameters to the subreport).

trans-unit.source: : Integrating a Subreport
Note
If the subreport is placed in a table or matrix, it will be rendered for each line. In this case, the value of the parameter “RectangleForNo” for each line is relevant.

seg-source.mrk: If the subreport is placed in a table or matrix, it will be rendered for each line.
In this case, the value of the parameter “RectangleForNo” for each line is relevant.

trans-unit.source: Expression for value:
=Fields![<SubreportIdentifier>_]FD_RectangleForNo.Value

If the subreport is placed outside of a table or matrix, the First function must be used. The First function returns the first value in a set of records, after sorting and filtering of a specified area is applied.

seg-source.mrk: If the subreport is placed outside of a table or matrix, the First function must be used.
The First function returns the first value in a set of records, after sorting and filtering of a specified area is applied.

trans-unit.source: Expression for value:
=First(Fields![_]FD_RectangleForNo.Value)

seg-source.mrk: =First(Fields![_]FD_RectangleForNo.Value)

trans-unit.source: Important
It is required to calculate the field of Data Type = BLOB via the C/AL function CALCFIELDS in the trigger OnAfterGetRecord of the DataItem because the BLOB content is provided to the DataSet.

seg-source.mrk: It is required to calculate the field of Data Type = BLOB via the C/AL function CALCFIELDS in the trigger OnAfterGetRecord of the DataItem because the BLOB content is provided to the DataSet.

trans-unit.source: Visibility Settings for Elements of a Subreport

seg-source.mrk: Visibility Settings for Elements of a Subreport

trans-unit.source: The subreport control allocates a small area on the report, even if no formatted text is printed. To disable the allocation, always hide the subreport control by default.

seg-source.mrk: The subreport control allocates a small area on the report, even if no formatted text is printed.
To disable the allocation, always hide the subreport control by default.

trans-unit.source: : Order Confirmation with Default Report Output

seg-source.mrk: : Order Confirmation with Default Report Output

trans-unit.source: To ensure that the visibility of integrated subreport elements is set to “Hide,” right-click the subreport and select Subreport Properties.

seg-source.mrk: To ensure that the visibility of integrated subreport elements is set to “Hide,” right-click the subreport and select Subreport Properties.

trans-unit.source: : Accessing Subreport Properties
In the Subreport Properties page, select the Hide option.

seg-source.mrk: In the Subreport Properties page, select the Hide option.

trans-unit.source: : Hide Subreport
Visibility Settings for Elements of a Subreport in Tables and Matrices

seg-source.mrk: Visibility Settings for Elements of a Subreport in Tables and Matrices

trans-unit.source: For avoiding empty subreport elements (subreports, for those where no content created in cc|formatted documents exists) to reserve space, it is necessary to set the visibility of a line containing the subreport element to “Hide.”

seg-source.mrk: For avoiding empty subreport elements (subreports, for those where no content created in cc|formatted documents exists) to reserve space, it is necessary to set the visibility of a line containing the subreport element to “Hide.”

trans-unit.source: : Subreport as Empty Line
To ensure that the visibility of lines containing subreport elements is set to “Hide,” right-click the row and select Row Visibility. In the Row Visibility page, select the Hide option.

seg-source.mrk: To ensure that the visibility of lines containing subreport elements is set to “Hide,” right-click the row and select Row Visibility.
In the Row Visibility page, select the Hide option.

trans-unit.source: : Accessing Row Visibility and Row Visibility page

seg-source.mrk: : Accessing Row Visibility and Row Visibility page

trans-unit.source: If the settings were made correctly, the output of the result is optimal. cc|formatted documents shows hidden elements independently, as required.

seg-source.mrk: If the settings were made correctly, the output of the result is optimal.
cc|formatted documents shows hidden elements independently, as required.

trans-unit.source: : Subreport with hidden Row
